timeline.bodyText: @victornoel  Why is it a Scalar and not a Runnable?
timeline.author: andreoss

replies.bodyText: @andreoss Runnable.run does not throw an exception so it makes it awkward to assign a scalar (from the constructor) into a  runnable (while the opposite is acceptable). Now that I think about it, I could have wrapped the scalar into unchecked at the constructor level. I will do that for consistency sake with other similar classes.
replies.author: victornoel

timeline.bodyText: @victornoel This type of ctor doesn't make much sense, why would one want to wrap pre-existing Proc with ProcOf?

replies.bodyText: @andreoss it's mainly useful to force type a lambda: new ProcOf(x -> { /* do something with x */ ; })
